PARAGRAPH.STRING: (or Lapche Kang, Lobuche Kang I, Choksiam) is a high peak of the Himalayas in Nepal/Tibet, on the main chain on the watershed separating the Sub-Continent of India from Tibet.
lies in a little-known region known as the Labuche Himal.
was first climbed in 1987 by a Tibetan-Japanese expedition, via the West Ridge. According to the Index, there have been no subsequent attempts or ascents.
